alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 7:49AM MDT until August 21 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River Below Acme affecting Chaves County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pecos River below Acme. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Left bank is ~10ft above gage and subject to overflow At 13.0 feet, Inundation of low laying areas...mostly range land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 10.67 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 13.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.1 feet on 07/08/1960. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Pecos River Acme 13.0 10.7 Sun 6 am MDT 8.2 7.3 6.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 700 PM MDT.
